pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.16.1: Sp.2.886: Sacepi udakasāṭikacīvaraṃ mahagghaṃ hoti, na sakkā nivāsetvā bahi gantuṃ, evampi naggāya nhāyituṃ vaṭṭati; “Also, if her bathing robe is valuable, or she is unable to put on a lower robe before going outside, then it is allowable to bathe naked.” The implication of this is that this rule concerns outdoor bathing, which fits the origin story.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:2.2.2: Because the context here is broadly similar to that of bhikkhu nissaggiya pācittiya 6, I render naṭṭha here as "ruined" rather than "lost".
